result.execSummary:
The defendant Deangelo Brandon Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: BOTH COUNTS:  Pay all costs, surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge. To be paid within term of probation or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work, school and treatment.

Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work, school and treatment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deangelo Brandon Carter in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  COUNT 1:    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  


The Court sentenced the defendant to serve
 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 
6 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  
- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.  

COUNT 2: 

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve
 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 
0 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Deangelo Brandon Carter in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date, case rescheduled.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-02-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deangelo Brandon Carter in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Paul Hauer.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant sworn.
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.  Court advised the defendant that he may no longer vote until his civil rights are restored.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deangelo Brandon Carter in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-02-2014 at 08:30 am.

Stipulation to a bail motion is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.
DEFENDANT IS ORDERED REMOVED FROM GPS MONITORING.  Court orders other terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.

Defendant Deangelo Brandon Carter in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Deangelo Brandon Carter in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/5/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and Electronic Monitoring.  To be monitored by drug testing.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Deangelo Brandon Carter in court with attorney Anne Jaspers.  Defendant Deangelo Brandon Carter in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. 
 DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
